Review.Titre: I and my partner both got the flu...
Review.Contenu: I and my partner both came down with the flu 2 days before a concert. I went to the urgent care instead of the hospital and was seen by a PA instead of a doctor. The partner was sick and stayed home. I sent in a copy of the urgent care statement but FanShield said it had to be signed by a doctor. It would cost more to see a doctor to get a signed statement after the event than the tickets cost, so learned it is not worth it to get the insurance.

Review.Titre: Dispute FanShield charges you did not authorize
Review.Contenu: I am in the process of reporting Protecht/FanShield to the FCC, FTC and BBB. The company fraudulently charged me for Refund Protection which I NEVER, EVER purchase for my travels or events. The  non-authorized charge appeared on my bank debit card along with the authorized hotel fee.My bank offered to refund the charge, eat the cost and issue me a new debit card.   Why should my bank eat the cost, albeit it a minimal amount, and I have to endure the hassle of a new card because of Protecht/FanShield’s thievery?My advice to consumers is do not use HotelPlanner.com as a liaison for booking a hotel because it allowed me to incur the fraudulent charge from Protecht/FanShield.I have emailed back and forth about this issue for one week.  No refund has been issued.  Time for talk is over. I am going all out to alert others and try to prevent FanShield and its cohorts from stealing from innocent consumers. I also want the bogus charge  along with an aggravation amount paid to myself.

Review.Titre: I had 2 unauthorized transactions on my…
Review.Contenu: I had 2 unauthorized transactions on my credit card for insurance protection I didn't purchase.  I reached out via e-mail to fanshield and was told the charges were voided and refund was issued, but I am still seeing the 2 unauthorized transactions on my credit card.

It's an absolute joke. They require so much paperwork to say you can't come. Why bother paying extra for insurance when they'll basically refuse to refund you without a million extra steps. They wanted me to pay $40 copay to get a doctor's note saying I was injured for a $30 refund. It should not be this hard. Literally you pay extra for absolutely nothing because they will not refund you. I will never insure an event again because either way I'm out of the money but at least I won't be out any extra cash for paying for this useless service.

Review.Titre: If I could give no stars
Review.Contenu: If I could give no stars, I would. Don’t waste your money. The documentation requested is never sufficient enough if you can’t make an event, just forgo losing the money and don’t invest any money in this company to protect your purchase.

Absolutely awful experience. My family wanted to go to six flags and with kids and unpredictable weather - we decided to protect ourselves by getting this horrible insurance plan. We learned quickly that the weather is going to be bad and rainy and it’s no fun at all to go to amusement park so we reached out to six flags who indicated that BECAUSE we bought this garbage insurance we cannot change our tickets or get a refund and HAVE to go through insurance. We went ahead and opened a claim and got in response “ The coverage under this peril (Unforeseen Severe Weather) would apply as such: “Severe weather conditions which result in your inability to attend the event. You must be unable to reach the event by car or travel carrier. This does not include weather such as heavy snowfall with roads open, ice on roads, or abnormally heavy rain, unless the intervention of authorities is involved.”So basically what this means is that unless ROADS ARE CLOSED we have to show up and “enjoy” ourselves and no matter that we got this insurance we are at full loss. In fact we could have easily changed the dates but because we got this insurance we are totally and royally screwed.

I had bought tickets to Six Flags to surprise my 13 year old who had been asking me to take her for her birthday. I could not have predicted that a tropical storm would have been coming that weekend when I bought the tickets weeks before. When I went to request a refund they denied me based on not providing them with proof of road closures when I had proof of the amount of rain we had gotten in NJ that weekend including articles regarding flooding. I am appalled that the articles I had provided, which clearly stated a tropical storm was happening in NJ that weekend and even showed pictures of the flooding wasn’t enough. I would hope that everyone in the company would have the common sense to never put their family lives at risk during such a situation. It sickens me. Never will I deal with this sick company or six flags again.

Review.Titre: Denied claim of death in the family
Review.Contenu: I had a death in the family and had the funeral a few days before the day of the event. We had a small family memorial service the day of the event that wasn't posted publicly so I was unable to attend the event. I had to submit PROOF OF DEATH which already seemed a bit invasive and insensitive. They denied my claim due to the funeral being a different day. They refused to refund no matter what I told them. They will do anything to avoid a payout. I wish I could give them 0 stars. I will never use this garbage service again!

Review.Titre: Took advantage or a divorcing Veteran
Review.Contenu: I recently purchased this insurance, I had planned to travel to great adventure and bringing my daughters with me.  I’m a 26 year Army Veteran still active and had the opportunity to spend some much needed time with children. I’m currently going through a divorce, and the judge decreed in a (COURT ORDER) that I no longer can visit with my children in person and would be limited to 15 minutes Face Time.  This court order prohibits me from bringing my children on this trip.  I submitted proof that shows the court order eliminates in person visits now They denied my refund…saying, by using the word court, order they mean jury duty. That is not advertised anywhere.  They will be hearing from my lawyer.   It was clear I paid the veterans price and instead of being more empathetic to the nature of a soldiers lifestyle, they try and find loopholes to take advantage.  Just wanted anyone who is considering using this service …don’t

Fansheild policy take advantage of people. The music ARTIST CANCELLED the show and they refuse to reimburse my insurance fee after the event reimbursed my ticket money. I called my credit card company and that was resolved quick and fast. Do the math, if they refuse to give back money to 20,000 people. They made over 50k Thousand Dollars in one night and the show was still cancelled.

Review.Contenu: The refund process here is outrageous. This place is requesting medical documentation from weeks ago stating he was in the hospital and I don’t have any doctors notes from them stating I help care for him and I cannot leave the area. So due to me wanting to care for a very ill family member instead of leaving the city, I now have to lose $400.

My car won’t run anymore and I can’t go to a concert in 2 weeks that’s 4 hours away. I’m not going to rent a car because that is even more money to spend and I am not 25 so I couldn’t rent even if I wanted to. What is the purpose of paying for ticket protection if you can only get refunds on their terms. It’s a waste of money and it’s just another way to shake more money out of you. And what’s with the BS of denying any claim that is more than 2 days before the event?

The airline sent travel interruptions to us to change our flights for the 2/20-2/24 Minnesota weather because of a blizzard coming to my Minneapolis flight destination. I showed all that in my claim and all natl weather reports. They would not refund and the lady argued with me she wouldn't and expected us to fly on with the possibility of being stuck sleeping in an airport for days as flights cancelled. Then they argued that the streets would have to be closed so prove that to them. I didn't see their 72 hour cancelation or the email until she told me it was sent after. That has nothing to do with the severe weather that came the days prior to the trip right before. I saw the bad better business bureau 1 rating so if you are smart, read their reviews and don't give them a dime. I'm not providing no claim number for this company to come back with some blanket explanation to save face. They are scammers and don't give them one penny.

Additionally, requiring that an entire form be filled out with over 15 questions that an Attending Physician would need to fill out in order for the ticket holder to receive a refund is absolutely absurd. This was a surprise date at the Gaylord Texan that I had purchased and presented to my girlfriend, which would have been her very first ICE! Experience with me. Now I’m having to send her with a friend while I stay at home. Absolutely pathetic customer service, horrible purchase portal layout, shady Terms & Conditions, and overall an incredibly sketchy, deceitful, experienced, as well as the single most ridiculous process of proving an illness I’ve ever seen in my entire life.COVID-19 regulations often had businesses simply asking for a vaccination card, proof of a negative COVID-19 test, or to get tested AT the facility. COVID-freakin-19. Not something like Pink Eye or Strep Throat. COVID. Absolute joke of a company and one of the single most horrendous experiences I’ve ever had with a company. I’d sue if this had involved a larger sum of money.

Review.Titre: I only rated a 2 because they did…
Review.Contenu: I only rated a 2 because they did respond quickly.  I bought this protection because I thought it would be good to have in case we couldn't make it to the event.  When you first read about it they make it sound like it would be easy to get a refund if need be, only to find out unless you have a major, mostly unheard of reason, you will not receive a refund.  Travel plans can change all the time and with family coming from out of state I thought I would be covered if they couldn't make it.  They responded very quickly to tell me my reason did not qualify for a refund.  I will never purchase this kind of "protection" again.  Lesson learned.

I assume that meant no refund if you havent purchased the extra fanshield. My husband is coming from Edmonton and this time of year really anything could happen.

Review.Titre: They don’t reimburse for when life happens
Review.Contenu: I spent money on tickets that I didn’t use because timing and the physical condition of people in my party didn’t allow for it. It’s not covered by Fanshield. The cost of unused tickets was roughly $50, and the cost of Fanshield was also about $50, so basically all Fanshield did was double the cost of unused services. My total spend on tickets was $360 not including Fanshield. I got the plan thinking worst-case scenario we don’t get to the location, we can be reimbursed. However, it would actually require a life-threatening emergency for reimbursement. Normal events, like a toddler recovering from a cold needing to stay in bed, or a parent with a disability not being able to make her way to the event site, are not covered, and those are the very common occurrences that can mess up a schedule and cause money to be wasted. I wouldn’t recommend buying this product for tickets that cost less than $50.

The description of the terms and conditions is a lengthy and detailed document.  It leaves impression that surely the company will find a way not to cover your claim.  I resigned myself to shrugging my shoulders and concluding I had probably just wasted money.

I will update this if I get a response from FanShield.  It has been 24 hours since my initial request for a refund as of this writing.  Some important things you need to know.  Keep your documentation, if you need to go to the hospital (such as I did) for surgery FanShield will ask you for your medical records of this visit!  I think this is an obvious HIPPA violation, but I did comply.  Despite all of this I have yet to get a reply from a "human". Only "We are review your documents and will get back to you shortly".Update:Fanshield wants a signed note from your doctor, despite giving them my discharge official documents from office staff. This was not good enough. The process made me feel like I was in grade school. They also again wanted proof of purchase which I had already sent to them. Finally they wanted to know why my wife couldn't go to the same event that I obviously could not go to. At the end of jumping thru all of these hoops I did receive my refund thru PayPal. You have choices on this, your bank account, no way I am giving acct number to them, a mailed check, PayPal or Zelle. I will not use this set ice again.

Review.Titre: Too many documents required to verify…
Review.Contenu: Too many documents required to verify illness.  If there is an official diagnosis of influenza, why require a doctor's note saying not to go to public sporting events with a communicable illness. Just plain painful to gather the required documents.

Bought the weather insurance for a concert 2 months in advance.  Living in upstate New York, I received a do not travel by the DOT andso they paid for my ticket.  Another person living in Rochester was stopped at the thruway entrance and couldn't go - due to an accident on the road - they refused to pay for her ticket.  2 relatives were arriving from Virginia but hit an accident on the road in PA.  They wouldn't have made it in time for the concert.  Fanshield refused to pay.  READ THE WEATHER SECTION VERY CAREFULLY Before purchasing cause the only cause they accept is if the DOT states NO UNNECESSARY TRAVEL or the Roads are closed.   First time using this service.  Won't use again.

Review.Titre: Do better in situations like this...
Review.Contenu: Honestly one of the worst customer services experiences of my life. I have worked in and been the manager of a major customer service team and never had to jump through hoops like I did for this. My wife's father had a liver transplant - 4 days before our tickets to an amusement park were supposed to be used in Ohio (we live in Oklahoma). We canceled our flights, and every other event we had scheduled to come see him the day he had the surgery. Got a refund easily from everyone else, except fan shield. We provided documents showing he was on the list, that he got his new liver on the date we said and etc... still got drug along and asked for more documents... Was only until we got ahold of Aaron that anything was done. I honestly would give this a one star if it wasn't for Aaron, he went to bat for us. Understanding how big of a headache this has been for us and for our family. We really truly appreciate him. In the future, maybe have a little more understanding when a family is going through something like a transplant. It's not a planned event, we were told he was going to be waiting a couple of months for the liver but found a perfect match much sooner. So, it was a shock to us all. We finally received our refund 3 weeks later, thanks to Aaron.

Review.Contenu: 3/5 because I feel the company could be more up front on what's required in order to get a refund. I was unable to attend an event due to a sudden illness. I was asked to provide documentation from my doctor and also explain why the other ticket holders could not attend. They were my minor children so of course they were unable to attend. I received my refund, chose venmo and the money was on there the same day I submitted the additional information needed. They did require my doctor to specifically state I am unable to attend "event name" due to acute illness. When you purchase the protection I think a disclaimer about documentation needed should be displayed so there are no surprises. I would purchase the protection plan again in the future and it makes sense why they need this proof or they'd be out a lot of money. I also noticed they don't cover COVID related events which is strange. You'd think they would as long as proof of a positive test from your doctor is given or some kind of note from your doctor about being exposed. I think its a bad look for the company to rule out any covid related issued all together. Fortunately, my illness wasn't COVID related, but feel for the ones who end up sick, unable to attend their event, then to be told they are out the money.

My rating is based on two very separate issues.  If I were to rate FanShield's service, I would have to give them a 5 star.  We needed to take advantage of our trip insurance after missing an event due to the illness of a family member.  FanShield was quick to respond and issue a reimbursement to us via our choice of methods.  However, I am only rating them as a 4 star because it was impossible to reach them on the phone. FanShield immediately reached out to me and solved my problem.  I appreciate their time and helpfulness in sending my reimbursement.

11.21.21 UPDATE: Corey from Fanfare reached out to me to discuss the matter. He was incredible in his handling of the situation. He understood my frustration and vowed to help make some changes so that there is less confusion of coverage in the future and he got us our money back. I will use Fanfare again in the future but i will make sure that I understand the basics of the fine print first. Beware...they have their fine print worded in such a way that they can basically get out of almost any claim. They state directly in their advertising that they cover illness, however, in their terms and conditions they state that they don't cover pandemics. I took this to mean that they would not cover claims if there was a large outbreak and the event was cancelled... that is not the case. They do not cover Covid claims at all! IMO this should be CLEARLY stated on the front of their advertising.
While in the end I did receive my refund, there was a lot of redundancy.My doctor’s note said it all but was asked multiple times over to give the same information.

Review.Titre: Natasha is what made my experience…
Review.Contenu: Natasha is what made my experience great!  Her customer service and people skills are beyond words.  On November 15th (my 37th wedding anniversary) I was in Nashville from Florida.  My husband and I had chicken for lunch and contracted food poison.  We had to cancel our anniversary dinner reservation that night and the dinner cruise we were scheduled for on the night of November 16th.  We were unable to go anywhere after eating the chicken until we checked out on the 19th.  Initially, we were denied our refund for the dinner cruise ($286.74).  Finally after numerous frustrating e-mails, Natasha reached out and resolved the issue in an extremely short amount of time.  I really don't think we would have received our refund had it not been for her and her dedicated customer-oriented approach.  Natasha certainly showed her integrity and went over and beyond to get us a positive resolution.  She is a role model for her co-workers.  You are fortunate to have her in your company.  Rick & Kathy Hartenstein
They made my process of getting my money back quick and easy!

At first they denied my request for a flooded out day, which my friend and I were supposed to attend six flags. I sent them the app “Waze” real time traffic updates of how things were closed and how they were multiple crashes blocking main ways to get there.I explained all this the first time, it wasn’t enough. The second time, after I was denied the first, ended up having to send articles of the day and how highways near me were flooded , was approved right away. Great communication , just send hardcore evidence first time round and you should be fine.

Review.Titre: Fanshield has an amazing Customer Service Agent
Review.Contenu: Natasha was the first agent I initially spoke with and was extremely helpful throughout my whole refund experience! It was so nice to actually have an agent who knew her job and was so pleasant to deal with (in this day and age it is a rarity!) I wish all the companies I contact and have to deal with were exactly like Natasha!

Madam/Sir,  Our experience with FanShield was greatly enhanced by Natasha P. in Customer Support.  She was professional and very helpful.  She helped me file my request and when I "snail mailed" the requested documents she tracked them down and submitted them. Because, in part, of her diligence we received a full refund as requested. My husband and I are very grateful.Ellen Marie Rose

Review.Titre: promote jacob in customer service and give him a raise
Review.Contenu: Jacob took down my problem after I discussed it with him...........fanshield involved themselves in helping me solve a problem with another company.......I do not know exactly what they did, but it played some role in me getting a refund that I otherwise would not have gotten............the problem affected their business as well as me personally, and they evidently brought up my case to bookonline.com and in communicating with them regarding fraudulent business practice,  secured for me a refund as I was originally told I would get.......Impressed with fanshield customer service and especially Jacob, a team lead...........give him both a raise and a promotion for helping me......Joe Vollink

Cameron is so kind. Extremely patient. Because our reason for filing a claim was based on Mom’s death…emotions were at there peak. He is a thoughtful listener. I was guided by him every step of the way on how to prepare the claim. The process was painless, because of the excellent consideration extended to us by Cameron and the entire team. Thank you very much. We will definitely choose your company again. The Smalls Family.

Review.Titre: First time that I had to submit a claim
Review.Contenu: First time that I had to submit a claim. I was very skeptical, and honestly expected a hassle.  But, FanShield made the whole process so easy!  I consider myself technology challenged, and the process was very straight forward.  Receiving a refund was also very quick.   I wouldn’t hesitate to ever use them again!

Review.Titre: Natasha was so helpfull, professional, polite, proud to work for your company, it showed in her voice she loved her job
Review.Contenu: Natasha was so helpfull, she took matters into hands, found a solution for my problem.Natasha was polite , respectful , very professional.I had been bounced around from agent to agent, USA and Canada....Natasha knows her work, did not give excuses, took matters in hand, and found the solution to my problem. i will not need to call or write to your company again. great job Natasha your company is lucky to have hired you.....

Review.Titre: Great service during a tough time.
Review.Contenu: I worked very hard to attend an important event but couldn’t due to unforeseen health issues. I had to call to get clarification about two areas in order to file a claim. The person answered the phone right away, not like other businesses that put you on hold forever. The gentleman was very professional, helpful and understanding. As a result, I filed my claim and received immediate information keeping me updated via emails. The process was simple, excellent and the matter resolved to matter satisfaction in a very short time. The entire process was handled very well and recommended anyone to use Fanshield.

Review.Titre: Quick refund when I had to withdraw from Boston Marathon
Review.Contenu: I had an accident that left me unable to run, let alone train for and race the Boston Marathon. I sent the details and a doctor's letter confirming the injury and medical advice, and they very promptly paid out the amount of my registration fee. It worked as advertised, so 5 stars.

fast and easy process. have only had to cancel a race twice in my life for a very serious injury, and the other time was a nightmare trying to get a refund.  this was easy, allowed me to upload my doctor note and quickly followed up with my refund. would rather be doing the race but glad I purchased this policy because I definitely didn't expect to be out for 6 months.  Would use them again for peace of mind!

When I was filling out the online claim form, I was having difficulty uploading some support documents, so I called your customer service. The rep was very helpful, and I was able to successfully complete the form.  My claim was accepted within 3 hours, and I received my refund check in a week.  I was very pleased with your services, and will definitely recommend your company to all my friends.

I would like to speak about the prompt attention that the reoresenatives of Fanshield showed my family concerning a claim with their company. We spoke with Corey on the phone and he diligently collected our information and presented it to his fellow representatives. In 24 hours he was back in touch with us and refunded our money back from the tickets we were unable to use. He was very polite, respectful showing empathy about our situation. I would strongly recommend Fanshield and will be using them again in the future. Thanks again Corey, we really aporeciate you handling our claim.

UPDATE: Fanshield contacted me and we were able to resolve my issue.  They honored my claim.  They misunderstood some information I sent them and once that was cleared up, all went well.  I am happy to say they have stood by their policy and would recommend them.  Just be aware that you need doctor notes or other documented proof for a claim.*******************I purchased their ticket insurance for the Opryland Oakridge Boys Christmas Show when booking the tickets on the Opryland website.   Unfortunately, I fell ill 2 days before and submitted a claim.  I then found out that there were only a limited number of reasons you could file a claim for and all required written proof. No problem, I got a note from the ER doctor. They denied my claim because my illness could be related to a pandemic! They further stated they would vigorously defend their company against any other claims...

Review.Titre: Nascar Cup Series tickets -Having purchased tickets to a Nascar…
Review.Contenu: Having purchased tickets to a Nascar event in 2023 I was unable at the time to purchase event insurance. However, I found that the insurance for the event was through Fanshield so I contacted them direct via email (This being the preferred contact method as I live in the UK and calling would have been extremely expensive). I received a prompt email detailing the method I needed to use to obtain the required insurance. However, due to personal circumstances I didn't use the link until some time later but was then informed that the link had expired. I emailed again and received a very gracious reply providing me with another link. I have now used this link and have purchased the insurance to cover all my costs associated with the event. Everything was dealt with expertly and with great support and service so keep up the good work.

Review.Titre: Fanshield Stands behind what they promise.

This option was available at time of purchase for my concert tickets which made it extremely easy! You never know what life is going to throw at you..I’m glad my time and money are protected!

Review.Titre: Fanshield followed up after claim was initially denied
Review.Contenu: Update to the below initial review: I received a follow up call and email from Corey, from Fanshield Customer relations, who explained that Fanshield has been reaching out to people who are denied claims by their partnering insurance company, to cover the claims directly 'out of the pocket' of Fanshield. So, ultimately though the claim was initially denied, Corey ensured I was compensated. I greatly appreciated the kindness and thorough follow-up.Original review: I bought this insurance for an event because it was advertised as  "covering illness".   I noticed others on this site buying this insurance due to uncertainty of COVID related events (as did I), but you should be aware, once you get the insurance you learn that they don't cover COVID, and will deny your claim if that is the illness that prevented your ability to attend the event.  My claim was denied due to "no coverage for a pandemic" even though they advertise that it is insurance that will cover illness, and even though I provided the requested documentation.
